author: 8BrickMario
review:
Of the villains in the series, the Mime was probably the one I wanted the least. Did my opinion improve?

Parts

The Mime has a nice head print that could be used elsewhere, and her lightning bolts and mohawk might also be desirable.

The minifigure

Camilla Ortin is a noise-hating villain who uses acrobatics and mime in her villainy. She also has electric gloves...because why not? Honestly, I think the people who created her gave her an awful design, so I'm not faulting LEGO for my not liking her. Her hair is the mohawk piece in dark blue, and her face is shown with some neat white paint depicting classic mime makeup. She has a slight scowl. Her outfit is hideous, being a black leotard over a black-striped pink jumpsuit. The stripes continue onto the sides of her arms and legs, and the details for her studded collar and netted top are also included. Her accessories are two of the classic lightning blasts. 

Overall

Get her if you like her design or like having completion, but if you don't, you're not missing much.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Holy Silent Scociopath Batman!
review:
Set #71017 Mime: I have no idea about this villain, she's a mime, but she shoots electricity from her hands? Sounds really dangerous.

Her print is nice with an interesting looking costume, she's got some nice arm printing with stripes that match her leggings and the punk rock hair peice in a nice dark blue tone, which is a pretty good piece to have multiples of. Her face has a nice sinister expression on it contrasted quite nicely with the two hearts printed under her eyes.

Overall a fairly decent character who scores quite high because of the parts which would make great for a lot of different circus themed characters. Trapeze artists and Tumblers for certain. Recommended.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: The most plain figure
review:
Opening;

Mime is a fine figure with two of the same accessory which is a cool and bland piece at the same time .

The Minifigure-

The hair is the Mohawk piece in dark blue , the face is very emotionless and features face paint , the torso is alright , the arm printing is ok and the legs and side printing are nice .

The accessories -

The accessories include two of the lightning piece which is overall just fine . The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion -

this is an alright figure with nothing particularly interesting so I don't really recommend  it unless you are like me and like to get all of the different villains .
